text: is a Japanese dish made with meat from wild boars. The name comes from the appearance of the meat as it is arranged before cooking. It looks like the flower "Botan (牡丹)" (English: peony). Another name for this food is Inoshishi- nabe (猪鍋). Hyogo Tourism Guide, "Botan-Nabe". Retrieved 2012-6-13. ==Ingredients== It has a lot of ingredients: boar meat, vegetables, root vegetables, mushrooms, konyaku, fu, and tofu. ==References== ==Other websites== * Tohoku University, Botan-nabe (wild boar stew) party Category:Japanese food Category:Meat dishes
title: Botan nabe
